de.wwu.muggl.instructions.general
Class Invoke

java.lang.Object
  de.wwu.muggl.instructions.general.GeneralInstruction
      de.wwu.muggl.instructions.general.GeneralInstructionWithOtherBytes
          de.wwu.muggl.instructions.general.Invoke
All Implemented Interfaces:
JumpException, JumpInvocation, StackPop, VariableDefining, VariableUsing
Direct Known Subclasses:
Invokeinterface, Invokespecial, Invokestatic, Invokevirtual
public abstract class Invoke
extends GeneralInstructionWithOtherBytes
implements JumpException, JumpInvocation, StackPop, VariableDefining, VariableUsing

Abstract instruction with some concrete methods for invocation instructions. Concrete instructions can be extended from this class.

This class implements VariableDefining. The instructions inherited from it does however not define variables in the currently executed method but in the method that will be invoked by them.

Version:
1.0.0, 2010-03-16
Author:
Tim Majchrzak

Constructor Detail

Invoke

public Invoke(AttributeCode code)
       throws InvalidInstructionInitialisationException
Standard constructor. For the extraction of the other bytes, the attribute_code of the method that the instruction belongs to is supplied as an argument.

Parameters:
code - The attribute_code of the method that the instruction belongs to.
Throws:
InvalidInstructionInitialisationException - If the instruction could not be initialized successfully, most likely due to missing additional bytes. This might be caused by a corrupt class file, or a class file of a more recent version than what can be handled.

invoke

protected void invoke(Frame frame,
                      boolean symbolic)
               throws ClassFileException,
                      ExecutionException,
                      VmRuntimeException
Invoke a method. This method encapsulates the whole invocation functionality and call methods specific to the distinct invocation instructions.

Parameters:
frame - The currently executed frame.
symbolic - Toggles whether the execution is symbolic, or not.
Throws:
ClassFileException - On fatal errors loading or parsing a class file.
ExecutionException - In case of fatal problems during the execution.
VmRuntimeException - If runtime exceptions occur.

checkStaticMethod

protected abstract ClassFile checkStaticMethod(Frame frame,
                                               java.lang.String[] nameAndType,
                                               Method method,
                                               java.lang.Object[] parameters)
                                        throws ExecutionException,
                                               VmRuntimeException
Do the checks for static/non-static methods calls and get the ClassFile of the object reference to invoke the method on for non-static ones. For some instructions it has to be neither the instance initializer nor the static initializer, or at least not the instance initializer. For invokestatic is has to be static.

Parameters:
frame - The currently executed frame.
nameAndType - The name and the descriptor of the method.
method - The resolved method.
parameters - The (yet unfilled) array of parameters.
Returns:
The ClassFile of the object reference to invoke the method on.
Throws:
ExecutionException - If an unexpected problem is found that does not throw a runtime exception but forces the virtual machine to halt.
VmRuntimeException - If an unexpected condition it met and a runtime exception is thrown.

                                    ClassFile objectrefClassFile)
                             throws ClassFileException,
                                    VmRuntimeException
Perform access checks if required by the instruction.

Parameters:
frame - The currently executed frame.
method - The resolved method.
objectrefClassFile - The ClassFile of the object reference to invoke the method on.
Throws:
ClassFileException - If a required class file cannot be loaded.
VmRuntimeException - If an unexpected condition it met and a runtime exception is thrown.

selectMethod

protected abstract Method selectMethod(Frame frame,
                                       Method method,
                                       ClassFile methodClassFile,
                                       ClassFile objectrefClassFile)
                                throws ClassFileException,
                                       VmRuntimeException
If required by the instruction, select the actual method for invocation and perform final checks on it.

Parameters:
frame - The currently executed frame.
method - The resolved method.
methodClassFile - The method's class file according to its name and descriptor.
objectrefClassFile - The ClassFile of the object reference to invoke the method on.
Returns:
The selected method. Might be the method specified.
Throws:
ClassFileException - If a required class file cannot be loaded.
VmRuntimeException - If an unexpected condition it met and a runtime exception is thrown.

pushZeroOrNull

public static void pushZeroOrNull(java.util.Stack<java.lang.Object> stack,
                                  Method method,
                                  boolean symbolic)
Check the return type of a native method and pushes a value onto the operand stack of the executing frame. This value will be null for reference types and the applying representation of zero for primitive types and their java.lang wrapper classes.

Only native methods will be processed. This method is only meant to be used if native methods are to be skipped AND their return values should be resumed to be zero / null values.

Parameters:
stack - The operand stack of the current frame.
method - The native method.
symbolic - Toggles whether a symbolic or a normal type is returned.

getTypesPopped

public byte[] getTypesPopped(ClassFile methodClassFile)
Get the types of elements this instruction will pop from the stack.

This method is supposed to be used for static analysis and not by any runtime components!

Specified by:
getTypesPopped in interface StackPop
Parameters:
methodClassFile - The class file of the method this instruction belongs to.
Returns:
The types this instruction pops. The length of the arrays reflects the number of elements pushed in the order they are pushed. Types are ClassFile.T_BOOLEAN, ClassFile.T_BYTE ClassFile.T_CHAR, ClassFile.T_DOUBLE, ClassFile.T_FLOAT, ClassFile.T_INT, ClassFile.T_LONG and ClassFile.T_SHORT, 0 to indicate a reference or return address type or -1 to indicate the popped type cannot be determined statically.
